alert.note: Alert for Monterey (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 11 at 7:59AM PST until March 11 at 11:00AM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Francisco has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... A Levee Failure on the Pajaro River in... Northwestern Monterey County in central California... * Until 1100 AM PST. * At 759 AM PST, Monterey County emergency management reported a levee breach on the Pajaro River east of Pajaro, near river mile 10, causing flash flooding of immediately surrounding areas. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding from a levee failure. SOURCE...Monterey County emergency management. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas near the levee break. * Pajaro This includes the following streams and drainages... Salsipuedes Creek, Elkhorn Slough, Coward Creek and Pajaro River. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE LEVEE FAILURE...OCCURRING
info.instruction: If you are in low lying areas along the you should move to higher ground immediately. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
